page.title: 09Fishing at Grafham Water.
page.content: Fishing is conducted annually, 1st April to 29th October and is overseen by a staff of five bailiffs and one fisheries officer. Fishing is prohibited close to the nature reserve and trolling is allowed only in a deep water area marked by buoys. Before each season, the water is stocked with rainbow and brown trout, some 50,000 in 1985. Replenishment continues throughout the season. Coarse fish find their way,as spawn, into Grafham water. Because coarse fishing is not permitted, the grown fish are regularly netted and used to restock Anglian rivers. Anglers must obtain a rod licence and a fishing permit and fish using either rod and line with artificial fly or with a feathered lure. Up to eight fish per angler per day may be caught.
